subtitle: Mouth watering tempting sweet pastries that are so more-ish you need enough for seconds...

method.text: Sift flour, salt and mixed spice in a bowl. Rub in butter until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs.
Beat together the egg, yolk and water and stir into the dry ingredients. Work into a smooth dough. Wrap in cling film. Chill for 30 min.
Make the filling. Mix together the cottage cheese, mixed spice, egg, egg yolk, currants and 50 g almonds.

Divide the pastry in half. Roll out one piece and use to line the base of a greased, shallow 18 cm x 28cm rectangular tin. Spread the cheese filling over the pastry. Roll out the remaining pastry. Cut into a rectangle the same size as the tin and place it over the filling.
To serve: dredge with the vanilla sugar and cut into triangles.
Brush the top with milk and sprinkle with the remaining flaked almonds. Bake for 20-25 min until lightly golden. Allow to cool.

title: Vanilla and cheese pastry triangles
